text: what's up everybody eric here with a video on how to use linear regression channels in your trading we're going to cover two things the first one is what are linear regression channels and really why i like them and then the second thing is how can we use them to trade now a lot of people at different points will have heard of things like standard deviation channels linear regression channels are different from standard deviation channels and we will explain how so let's start off with what linear regression channels are they are a price analysis tool and we typically use it to identify prevailing trends as well as extremes now there's two main components when we're talking about linear regression channels we're gonna have the line of best fit and then we're gonna have the channels themselves so let's take a quick look at what this looks like don't mind the rest of the noise on the chart i want you to focus on two things the first one is this purple trend line and then these dashed yellow linear regression channels notice one's a little bolder than the other one this is a 100 linear regression channel and then this is a 50 so what is a linear regression channel what it's doing is it uses whatever aggregation period that you're looking at so right now we're looking at a six month daily if i change this to a one year day notice how the linear

text: channel and then this is a 50 so what is a linear regression channel what it's doing is it uses whatever aggregation period that you're looking at so right now we're looking at a six month daily if i change this to a one year day notice how the linear regression itself changes what it's doing is it's creating a line of best fit which is this purple line that you see kind of that goes straight through the most of the data points it's exactly what it is it's just the statistical measure of each data point in the aggregation period and it creates a line of best fit for that then these dashed lines are built by using the price extremes within that aggregation period so notice at the 100 percent we see a touch up here at that level and then we also see price kind of touching below this level what this is doing it's taking instead of standard deviation channels which also uses a line of best fit but then it just plots standard deviations off of that line of best fit the difference is linear regression channels uses the price extremes to create the bands so a 100 linear regression channel is going to be out at the most extreme prices during that data set again in this case now it's a one year daily and then the 50 is going to be half of that move off of the line of best fit

text: bands so a 100 linear regression channel is going to be out at the most extreme prices during that data set again in this case now it's a one year daily and then the 50 is going to be half of that move off of the line of best fit so the reason why i really like linear regression channels is it's using the current data from the chart as a measure of price and giving you both trend and identification of extremes during that point similar to standard deviation channels we would expect to see in this case a hundred percent of data between the 100 level right because it's saying that we're gonna have the largest move is 100 that's the widest this band can go so as we get moves bigger than that this 100 band will move so the real utility though is just like any other statistical measure if you'll notice once we start hitting up near i always refer to it as a plus 2 standard deviation linear regression it's technically incorrect it's very close to that again because right now 100 of data falls between this as compared to you know 95 which falls between plus one minus two standard deviations so even the stats you know undergrad side of me gets a little peeved at that but it's just more efficient so in this case i'll refer to these as a plus two uh minus two linear regression channels or really you

text: falls between plus one minus two standard deviations so even the stats you know undergrad side of me gets a little peeved at that but it's just more efficient so in this case i'll refer to these as a plus two uh minus two linear regression channels or really you could call it plus three minus three which is 99.7 percent but the main point really is when we're looking at price the vast majority of price is going to fall within these two bands you will see things poke through it and again that's because it's based off of the aggregation period and that is why i don't say 100 percent falls within because even though you'll notice that there's nothing really closing below these bands they can still exceed it during intraday so again that's due to the aggregation period all right so let's talk about how we can use them to trade well i already told you let's start with kind of broader picture and zoom our way in broader picture trend analysis so this line of best fit is really useful because it's giving you the prevailing trend for the data set that you're looking at so when we're looking at iwm on a one year daily our trend line is decreasing it means that overall average price as right now is declining it's not growing it's declining so you can use this to get just general market sentiment that way the other thing you can
